p: Nobiletin (2-(3,4-dimethoxyphenyl)-5,6,7,8-tetramethoxychromen-4-one) ( Figure 4) is a polymethoxylated flavonoid found in citrus fruits, with anti-inflammatory [ 99], hepatoprotective [ 100], neuroprotective [ 101] and anticancer [ 102] properties. Nobiletin (5, 10, or 20 mg/kg, p.o.) and cimetidine (100 mg/kg, positive group) has protective effects on gastric ulcers induced by absolute ethanol in mice by stimulating cytoprotective PGE 2, antioxidant enzymes (SOD) and negatively regulating the expression of pro-inflammatory cytokines (TNF-Î± and IL-6) [ 103].
